greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Greatest inverse of A234742: a(n) = maximal k such that when it is remultiplied "upwards", from GF(2)[X] to N, the result is n, and 0 if no such k exists.
comment: Apart from zero, each term occurs at most once. 35 is the smallest positive integer not present in this sequence.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8192
formula: a(n) = maximal k such that A234742(k) = n, and 0 if no such k exists.
program: (Scheme) (define (A236847 n) (let loop ((i n)) (cond ((zero? i) i) ((= (A234742 i) n) i) (else (loop (- i 1))))))
xref: Differs from A236846 for the first time at n=91, where a(91) = 91, while A236846(91) = 35.
A236844 gives the positions of zeros.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 31 2014
